isis.stitle: TRW MANUAL STEERING GEAR - ADJUSTMENTS - OUTPUT ROLLERSHAFT OR TOTAL MESH

step1.para: After making correct worm preload adjustment, centralize the steering gear by rotating worm and input shaft assembly through full travel while counting the number of input shaft rotations. Then starting at one end of travel, rotate input shaft back half of the counted (total) rotations. This will place the roller of the output shaft in center of worm, or "straight ahead" position.
Rotate the worm and input shaft assembly with appropriate torque wrench (approximately 180 degrees) through center position. The required total mesh preload torque is:

item.para: 20 to 31 in-lbs. (2.3 to 3.5 Nm) without input shaft seals.
23 to 34 in-lbs. (2.6 to 3.8 Nm) with input shaft seals.

step1.para: Procedure for correcting output shaft or total mesh preload.

step2.para: Turn slotted adjusting screw as required to correct the total mesh preload, clockwise to increase preload and counterclockwise to decrease the preload. Repeat this procedure until the output shaft total preload is within specified torque limits stated in Step 2.
Hold adjusting screw in place and tighten locknut to 25 to 40 ft-lbs. (34 to 54 Nm).
Replace lubricant, re-install filler plug, and install unit in vehicle.

note.para: If correct total preload cannot be achieved, disassemble steering gear and repair.
